intro: Dichapetalum tesselatum, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and clusters of small, showy flowers that bloom in a variety of colors. The plant typically grows as a perennial herb, often reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a distinctive waxy texture, while its flowers are usually arranged in terminal umbels. Dichapetalum tesselatum is well adapted to shady, humid environments and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant.
